summary:
"There Will Be Blood" is a 2007 American historical drama film directed by Paul Thomas Anderson. It tells the story of Daniel Plainview, a determined miner-turned-oilman, played by Daniel Day-Lewis, seeking wealth during California's oil boom. The movie is loosely based on Upton Sinclair's novel "Oil!" and co-stars Paul Dano, Kevin J. O'Connor, and Ciar√°n Hinds.

The film received critical acclaim, especially for Day-Lewis' performance, which won him an Academy Award. It was nominated for eight Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Director. The movie was a commercial success, earning over $76 million worldwide.
